#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Ram Singh Malam
#Text=Ram Singh Malam
#Text=[ lower-alpha 1 ]
#Text=was a navigator , architect and craftsman from 18th century Kutch region ( now Kutch district , Gujarat ) of India .
#Text=When his ship got wrecked on a voyage , he was rescued by a Dutch ship which brought him to Holland .
#Text=He learned several European craft skills there , which were introduced to Kutch upon his return .

#Text=Despite being patronised by the ruler of Kutch for whom he built palaces including Aina Mahal and memorials , he is celebrated as a maritime folk hero whose artistic influence is still found in the region .
#Text=Early life
#Text=Ram Singh Malam was probably born in Okhamandal [ lower-alpha 2 ] region at the beginning of 18th century in a Wagher caste and started seafaring from an early age . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ]
#Text=At a young age , he lost his ship in a storm during a voyage to Africa and was rescued by a Dutch ship on the way to Holland ( now Netherlands ) . [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=On the way , they were attacked by pirates but survived .
#Text=He reached Holland with them and stayed for around 18 years . [ 3 ]

#Text=There , he learned several European craft skills including glassblowing , architecture , stone carving , clock making , tile work , enamel work , gun-casting and foundry work . [ 1 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ] [ 6 ]
#Text=Return to India
#Text=He returned to India when he was in his thirties [ 2 ] [ 3 ] and met several princes , but none were interested in his skills .
#Text=He went to Mandvi in Kutch where his skills were appreciated by the locals .
#Text=There , he met the Jadeja ruler of Kutch , Maharao Lakhpatji , in Bhuj who took him into service .
#Text=He established a workshop of enamel work at his palace and the craftsmen in gold and silver all over the state were invited to learn from him . [ 2 ] [ 5 ] [ 7 ] [ 8 ]
#Text=When Lakhpatji sent an army against Sumraji Thakore of Tera Fort to subdue the revolt , he used the artillery set up by Ram Singh Malam .
#Text=It was the first recorded use of the artillery power in the history of Kutch . [ 9 ]
#Text=With the help of the Maharao , he visited Europe twice to hone his skills .
#Text=Along with some apprentices , he is said to have visited Venice and Austria .
#Text=When he returned , he established a cannon foundry as well as tiles and glass factories near Mandvi where the sand suitable for production is found .
#Text=There , he made clocks and minutely copied patterns of European models and figures . [ 7 ] [ 5 ] [ 8 ] [ 4 ]
#Text=He also established a handicraft school in Bhuj . [ 5 ]
#Text=He was granted an estate of Kalyanpur village near Mundra by the Maharao for his service .
#Text=He died of old age . [ 2 ] [ 5 ] [ 10 ] [ 11 ]
#Text=Architecture and legacy
#Text=Corridor in Aina Mahal
#Text=Fuvara Mahal ( Pleasure Hall ) in Aina Mahal
#Text=Memorial cenotaph of Lakhaji
#Text=Ram Singh Malam is celebrated as a maritime folk hero and songs written on him are still sung in coastal regions of Gujarat . [ 5 ]
#Text=His influence on the architecture and decoration of Kutch can be still found . [ 1 ]
#Text=His technique of enamel work is now known as ' Kutch work ' .
#Text=The pieces created in his workshop are now housed in various museums . [ 3 ]
#Text=He designed and decorated Aina Mahal ( lit .
#Text=Palace of Mirrors ) in Bhuj for the Maharao Lakhpatji which cost eight million koris .

#Text=It was built in Indo-European style and decorated with glasses , mirrors and China tiles and also had a pleasure hall ; the palace is now converted into a museum storing a " europeanerie " [ lower-alpha 3 ] collection including clocks , wares , mechanical toys , paintings and pictures . [ 12 ] [ 13 ] [ 4 ]
#Text=He also designed the Old Palace built in Mandvi and the memorial cenotaphs of Deshalji and Lakhpatji in Bhuj . [ 2 ]
#Text=These constructions demonstrate European influence in design and decoration .
#Text=His characteristic sign in the architecture was merrymaking dutch boys with wine bottles and cups from whom he learned his skills .
#Text=These buildings were damaged in the subsequent earthquakes . [ 2 ] [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 10 ]
